intro: Sapium gibertii, commonly known as the red swamp gumbo, is a species of flowering plant native to the wetlands of southern Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, palmately lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by distinctive, inflated seed pods. It thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found in areas with rich, alluvial soils. Sapium gibertii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
